intro: Pelea penduliflora, commonly known as the hanging flower or pendulous flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pendulous inflorescences that hang from the stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Pelea penduliflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display and compact growth habit.
